title: Narrowhead catshark
text: The narrowhead catshark ("Bythaelurus tenuicephalus") is a <a href="catshark">catshark</a> of the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Scyliorhinidae">Scyliorhinidae</a>. This <a href="species">species</a> is described based on one <a href="adult">adult</a> and one juvenile male <a href="Biological%20specimen">specimen</a> from off <a href="Tanzania">Tanzania</a> and <a href="Mozambique">Mozambique</a> in the western <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>. The <a href="species">species</a> differs from its congeners by its slender <a href="head">head</a> and <a href="snout">snout</a>, which is only slightly bell-shaped in dorsoventral view without distinct lateral indention. It further differs from "<a href="Bythaelurus%20clevai">B. clevai</a>" by attaining a smaller maximum size and having a color pattern of fewer and smaller blotches, larger oral papillae, a shorter snout, and broader claspers without knob-like apex and with a smaller envelope and a subtriangular exorhipidion. Compared to "<a href="Bythaelurus%20hispidus">B. hispidus</a>", the species has a longer snout, a longer dorsal-caudal space, broader clasper without knob-like apex, and fewer <a href="vertebra">vertebra</a>l centra. In contrast to "<a href="Bythaelurus%20lutarius">B. lutarius</a>", "B. tenuicephalus" attains a smaller <a href="fish%20measurement">size</a> and has a blotched coloration, numerous <a href="Lingual%20papilla">oral papillae</a>, shorter anterior nasal flaps, a longer <a href="caudal%20fin">caudal fin</a>, a shorter pelvic anal space, and shorter and broader <a href="clasper">clasper</a>s.
